field.name: SBR
field.description:
Baud Rate Modulo Divisor (along with BDL[SBR])
 The 13 bits in SBR[12:0] are referred to collectively as BR. They set the modulo divide rate for the
 UART baud rate generator. When BR is cleared, the UART baud rate generator is disabled to reduce
 supply current. When BR is 1 - 8191, the UART baud rate equals BUSCLK/(16xBR)

field.name: RXEDGIE
field.description: RxD Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable (for RXEDGIF)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from RXEDGIF disabled (use polling)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RXEDGIF flag is 1

field.name: LBKDIE
field.description: LIN Break Detect Interrupt or DMA Request Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: LBKDIF interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: LBKDIF interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Even parity

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Odd parity

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Parity function disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Parity function enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Idle-line wakeup

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Address-mark wakeup

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal - start + 8 data bits (MSB/LSB first as determined by MSBF) + stop

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Use - start + 9 data bits (MSB/LSB first as determined by MSBF) + stop

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Selects internal loop back mode. The receiver input is internally connected to transmitter output

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Single-wire UART mode where the receiver input is connected to the transmit pin input signal

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Clock continues to run in Wait mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Clock freezes while CPU is in Wait mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Loop mode where transmitter output is internally connected to receiver input. [See also RSRC]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal transmitter operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal UART receiver operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: RWU enables the wakeup function and inhibits further receiver interrupt requests. Normally, hardware wakes the receiver by automatically clearing RWU

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter enabled

field.name: ILIE
field.description: Idle Line Interrupt DMA Transfer Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: IDLE interrupt requests disabled. and DMA transfer

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: IDLE interrupt requests enabled. or DMA transfer

field.name: RIE
field.description: Receiver Full Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: RDRF interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: RDRF interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled

field.name: TCIE
field.description: Transmission Complete Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: TC interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: TC interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled

field.name: TIE
field.description: Transmitter Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: TDRE interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: TDRE interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled

field.name: PF
field.description: Parity Error Flag\n PF is set when PE is set, S2[LBKDE] is disabled, and the parity of the received data does not match its parity bit.\n To clear PF, read S1 with PF set and then read D

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No parity error has been detected since the last time this flag was cleared. If the receive buffer has a depth greater than 1 then there may be data in the receive buffer what was received with a parity error

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one dataword was received with a parity error since the last time this flag was cleared

field.name: FE
field.description: Framing Error Flag\n FE is set when a logic 0 is accepted as the stop bit.\n To clear FE, read S1 with FE set and then read D

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No framing error detected

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Framing error

field.name: NF
field.description: Noise Flag\n NF is set when the UART detects noise on the receiver input.\n To clear NF, read S1 and then read D. When EN709 is enabled, noise flag is not set

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No noise detected since the last time this flag was cleared. If the receive buffer has a depth greater than 1 then there may be data in the receiver buffer that was received with noise

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one dataword was received with noise detected since the last time the flag was cleared

field.name: OR
field.description: Receiver Overrun Flag\n OR is set when software fails to prevent the receive data register from overflowing with data.\n To clear OR, read S1 when OR is set and then read D

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No overrun has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Overrun has occurred or the overrun flag has not been cleared since the last overrun occured

field.name: IDLE
field.description: Idle Line Flag\n After the IDLE flag is cleared, a frame must be received or a LIN break character must set the S2[LBKDIF] flag before an idle condition can set the IDLE flag.\n To clear IDLE, read UART status S1 with IDLE set and then read D

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver input is either active now or has never become active since the IDLE flag was last cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver input has become idle or the flag has not been cleared since it last asserted

field.name: RDRF
field.description: Receive Data Register Full Flag\n RDRF is set when the number of datawords in the receive buffer is equal to or more than the number indicated by RWFIFO[RXWATER].\n To clear RDRF, read S1 when RDRF is set and then read D

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The number of datawords in the receive buffer is less than the number indicated by RXWATER

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The number of datawords in the receive buffer is equal to or greater than the number indicated by RXWATER at some point in time since this flag was last cleared

field.name: TC
field.description:
Transmit Complete Flag
 TC is cleared when there is a transmission in progress or when a preamble or break character is loaded.
 TC is set when the transmit buffer is empty and no data, preamble, or break character is being transmitted.
 TC is cleared by reading S1 with TC set and then doing one of the following:
 - Writing to D to transmit new data.
 - Queuing a preamble by clearing and then setting C2[TE].
 - Queuing a break character by writing 1 to SBK in C2

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete)

field.name: TDRE
field.description: Transmit Data Register Empty Flag\n TDRE will set when the number of datawords in the transmit buffer (D and C3[T8])is equal to or less than the number indicated by TWFIFO[TXWATER].\n To clear TDRE, read S1 when TDRE is set and then write to the UART data register

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The amount of data in the transmit buffer is greater than the value indicated by TWFIFO[TXWATER]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The amount of data in the transmit buffer is less than or equal to the value indicated by TWFIFO[TXWATER] at some point in time since the flag has been cleared

field.name: RAF
field.description:
Receiver Active Flag
 RAF is set when the UART receiver detects a logic 0 during the RT1 time period of the start bit search.
 RAF is cleared when the receiver detects an idle character when C7816[ISO7816E] is cleared/disabled.
 When C7816[ISO7816E] is enabled, the RAF is cleared if the C7816[TTYPE] = 0 expires or the C7816[TTYPE] = 1 expires

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver idle/inactive waiting for a start bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver active (RxD input not idle)

field.name: LBKDE
field.description: LIN Break Detection Enable\n Selects a longer break character detection length.\n While LBKDE is set, S1[RDRF], S1[NF], S1[FE], and S1[PF] are prevented from setting

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is detected at length of 10 bit times (C1[M] = 0), 11 (C1[M] = 1 and C4[M10] = 0), or 12 (C1[M] = 1, C4[M10] = 1, and S1[PE] = 1)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is detected at length of 11 bits times (if C1[M] = 0 or 12 bits time (if C1[M] = 1)

field.name: BRK13
field.description: Break Transmit Character Length\n Determines whether the transmit break character is 10, 11, or 12 bits long, or 13 or 14 bits long

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is 10, 11, or 12 bits long

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is 13 or 14 bits long

field.name: RWUID
field.description: Receive Wakeup Idle Detect\n When RWU is set and WAKE is cleared, this field controls whether the idle character that wakes the receiver sets S1[IDLE]. This field must be cleared when C7816[ISO7816E] is set/enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The S1[IDLE] bit is not set upon detection of an idle character

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The S1[IDLE] bit is set upon detection of an idle character

field.name: RXINV
field.description: Receive Data Inversion\n Setting this field reverses the polarity of the received data input

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive data is not inverted

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive data is inverted

field.name: MSBF
field.description: Most Significant Bit First\n Setting this field reverses the order of the bits that are transmitted and received on the wire

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MSB (bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE]

field.name: RXEDGIF
field.description:
RxD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag
 RXEDGIF is set when an active edge occurs on the RxD pin.
 The active edge is falling if RXINV = 0, and rising if RXINV=1.
 RXEDGIF is cleared by writing a 1 to it

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred

field.name: LBKDIF
field.description: LIN Break Detect Interrupt Flag\n LBKDIF is set when LBKDE is set and a LIN break character is detected on the receiver input.\n LBKDIF is cleared by writing a 1 to it

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No LIN break character has been detected

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: LIN break character has been detected

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PF interrupt requests are disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PF interrupt requests are enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: FE interrupt requests are disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: FE interrupt requests are enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: NF interrupt requests are disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: NF interrupt requests are enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: OR interrupts are disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: OR interrupt requests are enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data is not inverted

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data is inverted

field.name: TXDIR
field.description: Transmitter Pin Data Direction in Single-Wire mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode

register.name: D
register.description:
Data Register
 Reads return the contents of the read-only receive data buffer and 
 writes go to the write-only transmit data buffer. 
 Reads and writes of this register are also involved in the automatic flag clearing mechanisms for the UART status flags

field.name: RT
field.description: Read receive data buffer or write transmit data buffer

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The parity bit is the ninth bit in the serial transmission

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The parity bit is the tenth bit in the serial transmission

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN1 is cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA2 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN2 is cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA1 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] flags are set, then the RDFR interrupt request signal is asserted to request an interrupt service

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] flags are set, then the RDRF DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: If C2[TIE] and S1[TDRE] flags are set, then the TDRE interrupt request signal is asserted to request interrupt service

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: If C2[TIE] and S1[TDRE] flags are set, then the TDRE DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer

field.name: PARITYE
field.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with a parity error

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The dataword was received without a parity error

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The dataword was received with a parity error

field.name: NOISY
field.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with noise

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The dataword was received without noise

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The data was received with noise

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer(FIFO), RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer(FIFO) and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter RTS is active low

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter RTS is active high

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: RTS is deasserted if the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is equal to or greater than RWFIFO[RXWATER]. RTS is asserted when the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is less than RWFIFO[RXWATER]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: IR disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: IR enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer Depth = 1 Dataword

enumeratedValue.name: 0b001
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer Depth = 4 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b010
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer Depth = 8 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b011
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer Depth = 16 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b100
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer Depth = 32 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b101
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer Depth = 64 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b110
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer Depth = 128 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b111
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer Depth = 1 Dataword

enumeratedValue.name: 0b001
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer Depth = 4 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b010
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer Depth = 8 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b011
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer Depth = 16 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b100
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer Depth = 32 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b101
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer Depth = 64 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b110
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer Depth = 128 Datawords

enumeratedValue.name: 0b111
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: RXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: RXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No flush operation occurs

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No flush operation occurs

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No receive buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one receive buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive buffer is not empty

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive buffer is empty

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit buffer is not empty

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit buffer is empty
